flawed_nl_solution:
He gets his pool cleaned 30/3=<<30/3=10>>10 times a month
Each time he gets it cleaned he tips 150*0.1=$<<150*0.1=15>>15
So he pays 150+15=$<<150+15=170>>170
So he pays 170*10=$<<170*10=1700>>1700 a month on cleaning
The chemicals cost 200*2=$<<200*2=400>>400
So in total, he pays 1700+400=$<<1700+400=2100>>2100
#### 2100

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 165, not 170. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
